availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John William Roberts (Johnson County, cabinet maker and soldier)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, cabinet maker and soldier. Nelson County, Kentucky native. Son of Horrace Roberts and Mary K. Roberts. Married to Louisa Ferguson Roberts on August 12, 1852. Father of James T. Roberts, Mary J. Roberts, William M. Roberts, Nancy Roberts, Daniel Roberts, and Elizabeth Roberts. Carpenter in Johnson County in 1850. Cabinet maker in Johnson County in 1860. Private in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia (U.S.A.) from May 21, 1864, to June 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 80B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 3.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Paintsville, p. 2.
Kentucky Marriage Records on Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994038, Johnson County Marriages, p. 1.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 895.
